title: Cultural Safety and Disease Prevention
brief: How to interact safely with locals while preventing disease transmission.
steps: Step 1: Build a separate shelter if possible to avoid physical contact with potentially diseased locals.
Step 2: Personally prepare your own food and drink if possible without giving offense.
Step 3: Use 'personal or religious custom' as explanation for isolationist behavior - locals usually accept this.
Step 4: Do not enter houses unless specifically invited.
Step 5: Respect personal property and local customs even if they seem odd.
Step 6: Keep any promises you make to maintain trust.
warnings: Local people may suffer from contagious diseases.
Avoid giving the impression you are deliberately avoiding contact.
Never violate privacy or enter homes uninvited.
